Engines

Class HuffmanEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engines.HuffmanEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICompression

    public class HuffmanEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICompression
    Engine that contains everything needed to Huffman encode and decode a file

      HuffmanEngine()

      builds frequency table for characters in a file.

      Huffman decodes the given huffman compressed file.

      gives the given characters bit representation as boolean array

      Huffman encodes the given file and writes it into new file

      Fills the prefix table into String array.
      void printTree(HuffmanNode node, java.lang.String prefix)
      For testing what the characters and prefixes associated to them are.
      protected int writeHeaders(java.io.FileOutputStream s, int trailingBits)
      Writes headers - that are needed for decoding - into the file stream
      void writeIntoFile(java.lang.String outputFilename, java.lang.String[] prefixTable, java.io.File file)
      First writes header data (Huffman tree and other data that the decoder needs) Then writes the uncompressed data from file into a new compressed file Prefixes are added bit by bit, and then trailing bits added if necessary.

      • buildFrequencyTable

        protected int[] buildFrequencyTable(java.io.File file)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        builds frequency table for characters in a file. Stores into integer array where index is corresponding extended ascii code. Value in that index is the amount of that ascii code in file
        Parameters:
        file -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • populatePrefixTable

        protected java.lang.String[] populatePrefixTable(HuffmanNode node,
                                     java.lang.String prefix)
        Fills the prefix table into String array. The index is the character in alphabet and the value in that index is the prefix for that character.
        Parameters:
        node -
        prefix -
        Returns:

      • writeIntoFile

        public void writeIntoFile(java.lang.String outputFilename,
                 java.lang.String[] prefixTable,
                 java.io.File file)
        First writes header data (Huffman tree and other data that the decoder needs) Then writes the uncompressed data from file into a new compressed file Prefixes are added bit by bit, and then trailing bits added if necessary.
        Parameters:
        filename -
        prefixTable -
        file -
